node.title: A Shop Where Kids Are Encouraged to Make a Mess
node.description: Cricket’s Candy Creations in Hudson Square holds candy workshops for children, and there’s “slime”.
node.content: ["Cricket\u2019s Candy Creations, a new outlet for children\u2019s creativity, experimentation and messing around, has opened in Hudson Square. Cricket Azima, a chef and entrepreneur who specializes in working with children and runs the Creative Kitchen, with online and in-person activities, and the Kids Food Festival, with events in various locations nationwide, has opened a spacious storefront studio for children\u2019s workshops. Several classes of 10 to 12 children can be held at a time. It involves edible finger paints, candy \u201cslime,\u201d chocolate and more to make all sorts of candy items, including jewelry, candy food like pizza, crafts and treats. Sessions are $65 to $80.", "Follow NYT Food on Twitter and NYT Cooking on Instagram, Facebook and Pinterest.
